item.title: Katrina add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "I was not ladylike, nor was I manly. I was something else altogether. There were so many different ways to be beautiful." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Jane Hamilton
item.description: "It is books that are a key to the wide world; if you can't do anything else, read all that you can." -- Jane Hamilton

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Steve Irwin
item.description: "Crocodiles are easy. They try to kill and eat you. People are harder. Sometimes they pretend to be your friend first." -- Steve Irwin

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "In no time the perennial borders were thick with rosy-pink foxglove and cream-colored lilies, each of which hung like a pendant, collecting dew on its satiny petals." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Rosie O'Donnell
item.description: "I know the best moments can never be captured on film, even as I spend nearly half my life trying to do just that." -- Rosie O'Donnell

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Outside, the September air was enticingly fragrant, yellow with pollen and rich, lemony sunlight." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "...(roses) each one shivering with cool silver light." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "love, I've come to understand is more than three words mumbled before bedtime." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "People hide their truest nature. I understood that; I even applauded it. What sort of world would it be if people bled all over the sidewalks, if they wept under trees, smacked whomever they despised, kissed strangers, revealed themselves?" -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "In the sunset of dissolution, everything is illuminated by the aura of nostalgia, even the guillotine." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Dr. Wayne W. Dyer
item.description: "Friends are God's way of apologizing for your family." -- Dr. Wayne W. Dyer

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Michael Beckwith
item.description: "I believe that you're great, that there's something magnificent about you. Regardless of what has happened to you in your life, regardless of how young or how old you think you might be, the moment you begin to think properly, there's something that is within you, there's power within you, that's greater than the world. It will begin to emerge. It will take over your life. It will feed you. It will clothe you. It will guide you, protect you, direct you, sustain your very existence, if you let it. Now, that is what I know for sure." -- Michael Beckwith

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "My faith in Christ is central to my life. My conversion from a pessimistic atheist lost in a world I didn't understand, to an optimistic believer in a universe created and sustained by a loving God is crucial to me. But following Christ does not mean following His followers. Christ is infinitely more important than Christianity and always will be, no matter what Christianity is, has been, or might become." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The Christian god can easily be pictured as virtually the same god as the many ancient gods of past civilizations. The Christian god is a three headed monster cruel vengeful and capricious. If one wishes to know more of this raging three headed beast like god one only needs to look at the caliber of people who say they serve him. They are always of two classes fools and hypocrites. " -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Whenever the people are well-informed, they can be trusted with their own government" -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Eve Ensler
item.description: "I think of the security of cages. How violence, cruelty, oppression, become a kind of home, a familiar pattern, a cage, in which we know how to operate and define ourselvesâ€¦" -- Eve Ensler

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Eve Ensler
item.description: "I finally know the difference between pleasing and loving, obeying and respecting. It has taken me so many years to be okay with being different, and with being this alive, this intense. (xxvi)" -- Eve Ensler

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I saw finally the futility of all these gestures, that witchcraft is but a matter of focus-that one cann apply one's fierce and immeasurable energies to an act of choice." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone ought to be." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle
